answers.answer: You describe a form of polyendocrine autoimmune disease. Schmidt Disease is the name given to type 1 diabetes(autoimmune), hypothyroidism and addison's disease(adrenal insufficiency). This can appear at different times and we watch all of our patients with type 1 for the appearance of any sign of the other endocrine problems mentioned. Sometimes when one of my patients with diabetes is having low sugars I am very very suspicious of Addison's. You are very sharp and good for you asking for testing.You need a pediatric endocrinologist they will be fine taking care of both and also has to be a good diabetes center, where in south florida specifically and I can give you names of folks there?Is she on cortef?, have her thyroid checked and screen her for celiac disease.One of my girls was a thyroid patient of mine for years, then got type 1 after 7 years, she also has parathyroid problems, so they can present in many fashions, just need to be prepared to watch for it and act when in doubt, you did that very well as her parent.

question: My daughter was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes a year and 4 months ago after presenting with Diabetic Keto Acidosis.  She survived the coma and her diabetes has been in good control for a year.  Just recently she was diagnosed with Addison's Disease, I requested the blood tests because she was not gaining weight and her skin was bronzing with her elbows and knees turning dark.  It is my understanding that both diseases together are called Schmidt's syndrome but there is not much information out there.  We live in South Florida and are desperately looking for a doctor that specializes in the treatment of both diseases. Do you have any suggestions on where I can get help or find more information on her condition?
title: Schmidt's Syndome
